page.title: 03PLACE NAMES AROUND ADELAIDE
page.content: The meaning of place names in our area tells us something of its history.{ {Queen Adelaide}takes its name from Adelaide,the wife of King William 1V; she died in 1849.{Quanea Hill}:'ea' is from the Saxon 'eg' ,island and 'quan' from 'cwafian', 'to quake' so this is quaking-bog island.{Thorney Hill}: island covered with thorn bushes.{ {Swaisdale Farm}: from the mediaeval name for the drain nearby , Swerdesdelf , meaning 'King's Drain'.{ {Wades Farm}:from its first owner whose surname, Wade 'is the Saxon Wada,whom legend says was a sea_giant honoured by the people living near the North Sea.{Roll's Lode}: a drainage ditch named from the man responsible for its digging.{Fodder Fen}: a fen from which fodder, cattle food,is obtained.
